mapper.sql: notice_id, title, content, `state`, begin_date, end_date, creator, update_date
mapper.insert: insert into notice (title, content, `state`, begin_date, end_date, creator, update_date) values (#{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{state,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{beginDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{endDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{creator,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})

insert into notice
title,
content,
`state`,
begin_date,
end_date,
creator,
update_date,

mapper.update:
update notice
title = #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
`state` = #{state,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
begin_date = #{beginDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
end_date = #{endDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
creator = #{creator,jdbcType=INTEGER},
update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where notice_id = #{noticeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update notice set title = #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, `state` = #{state,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, begin_date = #{beginDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, end_date = #{endDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, creator = #{creator,jdbcType=INTEGER}, update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where notice_id = #{noticeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select notice_id as noticeId , title, content, state , begin_date as beginDate , end_date as endDate , creator , update_date as updateDate from notice where state != "D"
